content: I have a set S : finset (ℕ × ℕ) and a sum over S of the form ∑ x in S, ... (for some expression ... that uses the two components of the pair x). Since each x is an element of S it's of type ℕ × ℕ. So is it possible to write the sum in a way that automatically deconstructs the pair, rather than having to write x.1 and x.2 in the summand? I've tried a few things, like ∑ ⟨a,b⟩ in S, ..., but nothing has worked so far.
You can probably write something like let ⟨a,b⟩ := x in after the comma, but it's a bit meh
No, the sum notation does not currently support that, sorry
Using this type of destructuring often makes things annoying to prove
Stuart Presnell has marked this topic as resolved.
